on of novel coronaviruses (amikacin variants)

The drug efficacy test was performed using the drug assembly prepared in example 3, lot 3 (using the spray device of example 1).

1. Cell lines and viruses:

VeroE6 cells. Novel coronavirus Omikou variant (BA.1.1.529) titre TCID 50 = 10 -5.5 100. Mu.L, stored at-80 ℃.

2. Experimental protocol:

(1) Cell control, virus control and drug component groups with different concentrations are set.

(2) The liquids prepared in lot 3, steps (1) and (2) of example 3 were diluted 2-fold, 4-fold, 8-fold, 16-fold, 32-fold, 64-fold, respectively, and placed into the pharmaceutical assembly of the present application (using the spraying apparatus of example 1).

(3) The cell density was set at 2X 10 5 VeroE6 cell suspensions of cells/NL were plated in sterile 96 well plates with 100. Mu.L of each well at 37℃with 5% CO 2 Culture 24 h was performed in the ambient.

(4) Discarding culture supernatant, mixing the spray solution with 100 TCID 50 Mixing virus solution 1:1, incubating at 37deg.C for 2 hr, transferring the above mixed solution onto 96-well plate, mixing with 100 μl/well of 4 compound wells, incubating for 2 hr, removing supernatant, adding maintenance medium, mixing with 100 μl/well, and incubating for 3 days. Cytopathic effect (CPE) was observed and the experimental results were recorded, recording CPE. The recording results are shown in table 7 below:

(5) Half maximal Inhibitory Concentration (IC) was calculated using Reed-Nuench method or GraphPad PrisN5.0 50 )。

experimental example 2: inhibition of influenza A H1N1 virus

The inhibition of influenza a H1N1 virus was evaluated using the pharmaceutical kit prepared in example 3, lot 3 (using the spray device of example 1).

1. Cell lines and viruses:

NDCK, hep-2, veroE6 cells, NDCK cells were expanded in 90NL dnan medium+1nl penicillin, streptomycin stock (100X) +10nl foetal calf serum, 0.01% EDTA-0.25% pancreatin.

Influenza a H1N1 virus PR8 strain. 99NL DNEN broth+1 NL antibiotic+150. Mu.L TPCK-pancreatin (stock solution concentration 1 Ng/NL) was prepared for use.

2. Experimental protocol:

(1) The spray liquid sprayed after pressing the spraying device in the medicine component is mixed with fresh H1N1 virus stock solution 1:1 for 1 hour. After 1 hour, the solution was diluted by a factor of 10 to 7 dilutions to 10 -7 . The virus control group was mixed with fresh H1N1 virus stock 1:1 with sterile water for 1 hour. After 1 hour, the solution was diluted by a factor of 10 to 7 dilutions to 10 -7 。
